intro: Elionurus pertusus, commonly known as the hooked spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and pairs of opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-yellow and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Elionurus pertusus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
